DOC.brief_summary: Specific Aims & Hypothesis Primary Aim : To evaluate laparoscopic bariatric surgery versus intensive medical weight management index insulin resistance resolution type 2 diabetes among patient BMI 30-35 . Hypothesis : Bariatric surgery effective treatment induce diabetes remission obese diabetic patient BMI 30-35 . The primary outcome assess 6 month : ( 1 ) within-patient change insulin resistance either bariatric surgery initiation intensive medical weight management , ( 2 ) remission diabetes , ( i.e. , fast glucose < 126mg/dL glucose < 200mg/dL two hour standard 75g oral glucose load without use anti-hyperglycemic medication ) . Insulin resistance assess randomization 6 month homeostatic model assessment insulin resistance ( HOMA IR ) base insulin fast glucose , well oral glucose tolerance test area-under-the-curve ( AUC ) measurement insulin value . Medication discontinuation derive electronic health record patient self-report 6 month . Secondary outcome include change HBA1c , weight , blood pressure , waist circumference , level fast lipid .
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness Bariatric Surgery Versus Medical Management Induce Diabetes Remission Diabetic Patients With BMI 30-35
